abstract: "Put the Needle on the Record: The 1980s at 45 Revolutions Per Minute," a new book by Matthew Chojnakci, looks at the distinctive album cover art of the 1980s - good and bad.
snippet: "Put the Needle on the Record: The 1980s at 45 Revolutions Per Minute," a new book by Matthew Chojnakci, looks at the distinctive album cover art of the 1980s - good and bad.
lead_paragraph: Before music came in clouds it came in sleeves. For the iTunes generation this may come as a surprise, but to buy music in the pre-digital era required a trip to a store, where rows of labeled bins held vinyl discs in a variety of formats: long-playing albums, 45s, 12-inch singles. These records, as they were called, came in paper sleeves that were covered front and back with artwork.

headline.main: New Book Covers the Covers of the 1980s
